A out on my hert whi brest Ã¾ou nowth And Ã¾ou art maydyn and modyr and seyst Ã¾us Ã¾i childe spylle how mayst Ã¾ou a-byde Ã¾is sorwe and Ã¾is woful Ã¾owth A deth deth deth why wylt Ã¾ou not me kylle. here oure lady xal swonge A-?en and ore lord xal seyn Ã¾us Jhesus O Ffadyr Al-mythy makere of man Ffor-gyff Ã¾ese jewys Ã¾at don me wo Ffor-geve hem fadyr for-geve hem Ã¾an Ffor thei wete notwh what Ã¾ei do. ius Judeus ?a vath vath now here is he Ã¾at bad us dystroye oure tempyl on A day and with-inne days thre he xulde reysynt A-?en in good A-ray. ijus Judeus Now and Ã¾ou kan do swech A dede help now Ã¾i-self yf Ã¾at Ã¾ou kan and we xal be-levyn on Ã¾e with-outyn drede and seyn Ã¾ou art a mythty man. iijus Judeus ?a yf Ã¾u be goddys sone as Ã¾ou dedyst teche ffrom Ã¾e cros come now down Ã¾an of mercy we xal Ã¾e beseche and seyn Ã¾ou art a lord of gret renown. jestes Yf Ã¾ou be goddys sone as Ã¾ou dedyst seye helpe here now both Ã¾e and vs but I fynde it not al in my feye Ã¾at Ã¾ou xuldyst be cryst goddys sone jhesus. Dysmas Do wey fool why seyst Ã¾ou so he is Ã¾e sone of god I be-leve it wel and synne dede he nevyr lo Ã¾at he xuld be put Ã¾is deth tyl. but we ful mech wrong han wrowth he dede nevyr Ã¾ing A-mys now mercy good lord mercy and for-gete me nowth whan Ã¾ou comyst to Ã¾i kyngham and to Ã¾i blysse. Jhesus Amen Amen Ã¾ou art ful wyse Ã¾at Ã¾ou hast Askyd I grawnt Ã¾e Ã¾is same day in paradyse with me Ã¾i god Ã¾ou xalt Ã¾er be. Maria O my sone my sone my derlyng dere what haue I defendyd Ã¾e Ã¾ou hast spoke to alle Ã¾o Ã¾at ben here and not o word Ã¾ou spekyst to me. To Ã¾e jewys Ã¾ou art ful kende Ã¾ou hast for-gove al here mysdede and Ã¾e thef Ã¾ou hast in mende for onys haskyng mercy hefne is his mede. A my sovereyn lord why whylt Ã¾ou not speke to me Ã¾at am Ã¾i modyr in peyn for Ã¾i wrong A hert hert why whylt Ã¾ou not breke Ã¾at I were out of Ã¾is sorwe so stronge. Jhesus A woman woman be-hold Ã¾er Ã¾i sone And Ã¾ou jon take her for Ã¾i modyr I charge Ã¾e to kepe here as besyly as Ã¾ou kone Ã¾ou A clene mayde xal kepe A-nother. And woman Ã¾ou knowyst Ã¾at my fadyr of hefne me sent to take Ã¾is manhod of Ã¾e Adam ys rawnsom to pay Ffor Ã¾is is Ã¾e wyl and my faderys intent Ã¾at I xal Ã¾us deye to delyuere man fro Ã¾e develys pray. Now syn it is Ã¾e wyl of my fadyr it xuld Ã¾us be Why xuld it dysplese Ã¾e modyr now my deth so sore And for to suffre Al Ã¾is for man I was born of the to Ã¾e blys Ã¾at man had lost man A-?en to restore. her oure lady xal ryse and renne and halse Ã¾e crosse. Maria Magdalena A good lady why do ?e Ã¾us ?our dolfol cher now cheuith us sore And for Ã¾e peyne of my swete lord jhesus Ã¾at he seyth in ?ou it peyneth hym more. Maria virgo I pray ?ow Alle lete me ben here and hang me up here on Ã¾is tre be my frend and sone Ã¾at me is so dere ffor Ã¾er he is Ã¾er wold I be. Johannes Jentyl lady now leve ?our mornyng and go with us now we ?ou pray And comfort oure lord at hese departyng ffor he is Al-most redy to go his way. here Ã¾ei xal take oure lady from Ã¾e crosse and here xal pylat come down from his shaffald with Cayphas and Annas and all here mene and xul come and lokyn on Cryst and annas and cayphas xul skornfully sey[n] Cayphas lo serys lo be-heldyth and se here hangyth he Ã¾at halpe many A man And now yf he goddys sone be helpe now hym-self yf Ã¾at he kan. Annas ?a and yf Ã¾ou kyng of israel be come down of Ã¾e cros Among us alle And lete Ã¾i god now delyuere the and Ã¾an oure kyng we wole Ã¾e calle. here xal pylat Askyn penne and inke and A tabyl xal be take hym wretyn A-fore hic est jhesus nazarenus rex judeorum. and he xal make hym to wryte and Ã¾an gon up on A leddere and settyn Ã¾e tabyl abovyn crystys hed and Ã¾an cayphas xal makyn hym to redyn and seyn Cayphas Sere pylat we merveylyth of Ã¾is Ã¾at ?e wryte hym to be kyng of jewys Ã¾erfore we wolde Ã¾at ?e xuld wryte Ã¾us Ã¾at he namyd hymself kyng of jewus. Pylat Ã¾at I haue wretyn wretyn it is and so it xal be for me i-wys. and so forth all Ã¾ei xal gon A ?en to Ã¾e skaffalde and Jhesus xal cryen heloy heloy lama?abathany my fadyr in hevyn on hy why dost Ã¾ou me for-sake The frelte of my mankende With stronge peyn yt gynnyth to peynde ha dere fadyr haue me in mende and lete deth my sorwe slake. ijus judeus me thynkyth he this doth calle hely lete us go nere and a-spy and loke yf he come preuely from cros hym down to reve. Jhesus So grett a thrust dede nevyr man take as I haue man now for Ã¾i sake for thrust a-sundyr my lyppys gyn crake for drynes Ã¾ei do cleve. iijus judeus ?our thrust sere hoberd for to slake ey?il and galle here I Ã¾e take what me thynkyth a mowe ?e make is not Ã¾is good drynk to crye for drynke ?e had gret hast and now it semyth it is but wast is not Ã¾is drynk of good tast now telle me how ?e thynk. 4us judeus on lofte sere hoberd now ?e be sett we wyl no lenger with ?ou lett we grete ?ou wel on Ã¾e newe gett and make on ?ou a mowe. ius judeus we grete ?ou wel with a scorn and pray ?ou bothe evyn and morn take good eyd to oure corn and chare awey Ã¾e crowe. Jhesus In manus tuas domine holy fadyr in hefly se I comende my spyryte to Ã¾e for here now hendyth my fest I xal go sle Ã¾e fende Ã¾at freke ffor now myn herte be-gynnyth to breke wurdys mo xal I non speke Nunc consummatum est. Maria Alas Alas I leve to longe to se my swete sone with peynes stronge As a theff on cros doth honge And nevyr ?et dede he synne Alas my dere chyld to deth is dressyd now is my care wel more in-cressyd A myn herte with peyn is pressyd Ffor sorwe myn hert doth twynne. Johannes A blyssyd mayde chaunge ?our thought Ffor Ã¾ow ?our sone with sorwe be sought ?itt by his owyn wyl Ã¾is werk is wrought And wylfully his deth to take ?ow to kepe he chargyd me here I am ?our servaunt my lady dere wherfore I pray ?ow be of good chere And merthis Ã¾at ?e make. Maria Thow he had nevyr of me be born And I sey his flesch Ã¾us al to torn on bak be-hyndyn on brest be-forn Rent with woundys wyde Nedys I must wonyn in woo to se my ffrende with many a ffo all to rent from top to too his flesch with-owtyn hyde. Johannes A blyssyd lady as I ?ow telle had he not deyd we xuld to helle Amonges ffendys Ã¾er evyr to dwelle In peynes Ã¾at ben smert he sufferyth deth for oure trespace and thorwe his deth we xal haue grace to dwelle with hym in hevyn place Ã¾erfore beth mery in hert. Maria A dere ffrende weel woot I this Ã¾at he doth bye us to his blys but ?itt of myrth evyr mor I mys whan I se Ã¾is syght. Johannes Now dere lady Ã¾erfore I ?ow pray Ffro Ã¾is dolful dolour wende we oure way Ffor whan Ã¾is syght ?e se nought may ?oure care may waxe more lyght. Maria Now sythe I must parte hym fro ?it lete me kysse or Ã¾at I go his blyssyd ffeyt Ã¾at sufferyn wo naylid on Ã¾is tre So cruelly with grett dyspyte Ã¾us shamfully was nevyr man dyghte Ã¾erfore in peyn myn hert is pyghte al joye departyth fro me. hic quasi semi nortua cadat prona in terram et dicit johannes Johannes Now blyssyd mayd come forth with me no lengere Ã¾is syght Ã¾at ?e se I xal ?ow gyde in Ã¾is countre where Ã¾at it plesyth ?ow best. Maria Now jentyl Johan my sonys derlyng to goddys temple Ã¾ou me brynge Ã¾at I may prey god with sore wepynge And mornynge Ã¾at is prest. Johannes All ?our desyre xal be wrought with herty wyll I werke ?our thought now blyssyd mayde taryeth nowth In Ã¾e temple Ã¾at ?e ware Ffor holy prayere may chaunge ?our mood and cawse ?our chere to be more good whan ?e se not? ?our childys blood Ã¾e lasse may be ?our care. Tunc transiet maria ad templum cum Iohanne et cetera. Maria Here in Ã¾is temple my lyff I lede And serue my lord god with hertyly drede now xal wepynge me fode and fede Som comforte tyll god sende A my lord god I Ã¾e pray Whan my childe ryseth Ã¾e iijd e day Comforte thanne thyn hand-may my care for to Amende.
